developerDoc.details: Provides information about the current execution context, including the sender of the transaction and its data. While these are generally available via msg.sender and msg.data, they should not be accessed in such a direct manner, since when dealing with meta-transactions the account sending and paying for execution may not be the actual sender (as far as an application is concerned). This contract is only required for intermediate, library-like contracts.

__gap.details: This empty reserved space is put in place to allow future versions to add new variables without shifting down storage in the inheritance chain. See https://docs.openzeppelin.com/contracts/4.x/upgradeable#storage_gaps

While these are generally available via msg.sender and msg.data, they should not be accessed in such a direct manner, since when dealing with meta-transactions the account sending and paying for execution may not be the actual sender (as far as an application is concerned). This contract is only required for intermediate, library-like contracts.","kind":"dev","methods":{},"stateVariables":{"__gap":{"details":"This empty reserved space is put in place to allow future versions to add new variables without shifting down storage in the inheritance chain. FinalizeDepositERC20(address,address,add.notice: Emitted when ERC20 token is deposited from L1 to L2 and transfer to recipient.

WithdrawERC20(address,address,address,ad.notice: Emitted when someone withdraw ERC20 token from L2 to L1.

finalizeDepositERC20(address,address,add.notice: Complete a deposit from L1 to L2 and send fund to recipient's account in L2.

getL1ERC20Address(address).notice: Return the corresponding l1 token address given l2 token address.

getL2ERC20Address(address).notice: Return the corresponding l2 token address given l1 token address.

withdrawERC20(address,address,uint256,ui.notice: Withdraw of some token to a recipient's account on L1.

withdrawERC20(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Withdraw of some token to a caller's account on L1.

withdrawERC20AndCall(address,address,uin.notice: Withdraw of some token to a recipient's account on L1 and call.

params.amount: The amount of token withdrawn from L1 to L2.
params.data: The optional calldata passed to recipient in L2.
params.from: The address of sender in L1.
params.l1Token: The address of the token in L1.
params.l2Token: The address of the token in L2.
params.to: The address of recipient in L2.

params.amount: The amount of token will be deposited from L2 to L1.
params.data: The optional calldata passed to recipient in L1.
params.from: The address of sender in L2.
params.l1Token: The address of the token in L1.
params.l2Token: The address of the token in L2.
params.to: The address of recipient in L1.

finalizeDepositERC20(address,address,add.details: Make this function payable to handle WETH deposit/withdraw.      The function should only be called by L2ScrollMessenger.      The function should also only be called by L1ERC20Gateway in L1.

params.amount: The amount of the token to deposit.
params.data: Optional data to forward to recipient's account.
params.from: The address of account who deposits the token in L1.
params.l1Token: The address of corresponding L1 token.
params.l2Token: The address of corresponding L2 token.
params.to: The address of recipient in L2 to receive the token.

withdrawERC20(address,address,uint256,ui.details: Make this function payable to send relayer fee in Ether.

params.amount: The amount of token to transfer.
params.gasLimit: Unused, but included for potential forward compatibility considerations.
params.to: The address of recipient's account on L1.
params.token: The address of token in L2.

withdrawERC20(address,uint256,uint256).details: Make this function payable to send relayer fee in Ether.

params.amount: The amount of token to transfer.
params.gasLimit: Unused, but included for potential forward compatibility considerations.
params.token: The address of token in L2.

withdrawERC20AndCall(address,address,uin.details: Make this function payable to send relayer fee in Ether.

params.amount: The amount of token to transfer.
params.data: Optional data to forward to recipient's account.
params.gasLimit: Unused, but included for potential forward compatibility considerations.
params.to: The address of recipient's account on L1.
params.token: The address of token in L2.

FinalizeDepositETH(address,address,uint2.notice: Emitted when ETH is deposited from L1 to L2 and transfer to recipient.

WithdrawETH(address,address,uint256,byte.notice: Emitted when someone withdraw ETH from L2 to L1.

finalizeDepositETH(address,address,uint2.notice: Complete ETH deposit from L1 to L2 and send fund to recipient's account in L2.

withdrawETH(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Withdraw ETH to caller's account in L1.

withdrawETH(uint256,uint256).notice: Withdraw ETH to caller's account in L1.

withdrawETHAndCall(address,uint256,bytes.notice: Withdraw ETH to caller's account in L1.

params.amount: The amount of ETH deposited from L1 to L2.
params.data: The optional calldata passed to recipient in L2.
params.from: The address of sender in L1.
params.to: The address of recipient in L2.

params.amount: The amount of ETH will be deposited from L2 to L1.
params.data: The optional calldata passed to recipient in L1.
params.from: The address of sender in L2.
params.to: The address of recipient in L1.

finalizeDepositETH(address,address,uint2.details: This function should only be called by L2ScrollMessenger.      This function should also only be called by L1GatewayRouter in L1.

params._amount: The amount of ETH to deposit.
params._data: Optional data to forward to recipient's account.
params._from: The address of account who deposit ETH in L1.
params._to: The address of recipient in L2 to receive ETH.

params.amount: The amount of ETH to be withdrawn.
params.gasLimit: Optional, gas limit used to complete the withdraw on L1.
params.to: The address of recipient's account on L1.

params.amount: The amount of ETH to be withdrawn.
params.gasLimit: Optional, gas limit used to complete the withdraw on L1.

params.amount: The amount of ETH to be withdrawn.
params.data: Optional data to forward to recipient's account.
params.gasLimit: Optional, gas limit used to complete the withdraw on L1.
params.to: The address of recipient's account on L1.

FinalizeDepositERC20(address,address,add.notice: Emitted when ERC20 token is deposited from L1 to L2 and transfer to recipient.

FinalizeDepositETH(address,address,uint2.notice: Emitted when ETH is deposited from L1 to L2 and transfer to recipient.

SetDefaultERC20Gateway(address,address).notice: Emitted when the address of default ERC20 Gateway is updated.

SetERC20Gateway(address,address,address).notice: Emitted when the `gateway` for `token` is updated.

SetETHGateway(address,address).notice: Emitted when the address of ETH Gateway is updated.

WithdrawERC20(address,address,address,ad.notice: Emitted when someone withdraw ERC20 token from L2 to L1.

WithdrawETH(address,address,uint256,byte.notice: Emitted when someone withdraw ETH from L2 to L1.

finalizeDepositERC20(address,address,add.notice: Complete a deposit from L1 to L2 and send fund to recipient's account in L2.

finalizeDepositETH(address,address,uint2.notice: Complete ETH deposit from L1 to L2 and send fund to recipient's account in L2.

getL1ERC20Address(address).notice: Return the corresponding l1 token address given l2 token address.

getL2ERC20Address(address).notice: Return the corresponding l2 token address given l1 token address.

setDefaultERC20Gateway(address).notice: Update the address of default ERC20 gateway contract.

setERC20Gateway(address[],address[]).notice: Update the mapping from token address to gateway address.

setETHGateway(address).notice: Update the address of ETH gateway contract.

withdrawERC20(address,address,uint256,ui.notice: Withdraw of some token to a recipient's account on L1.

withdrawERC20(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Withdraw of some token to a caller's account on L1.

withdrawERC20AndCall(address,address,uin.notice: Withdraw of some token to a recipient's account on L1 and call.

withdrawETH(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Withdraw ETH to caller's account in L1.

withdrawETH(uint256,uint256).notice: Withdraw ETH to caller's account in L1.

withdrawETHAndCall(address,uint256,bytes.notice: Withdraw ETH to caller's account in L1.

params.newDefaultERC20Gateway: The address of the new default ERC20 Gateway.
params.oldDefaultERC20Gateway: The address of the old default ERC20 Gateway.

params.newGateway: The corresponding address of the new gateway.
params.oldGateway: The corresponding address of the old gateway.

params.newEthGateway: The address of the new ETH Gateway.
params.oldETHGateway: The address of the old ETH Gateway.

finalizeDepositERC20(address,address,add.details: Make this function payable to handle WETH deposit/withdraw.      The function should only be called by L2ScrollMessenger.      The function should also only be called by L1ERC20Gateway in L1.

params.amount: The amount of the token to deposit.
params.data: Optional data to forward to recipient's account.
params.from: The address of account who deposits the token in L1.
params.l1Token: The address of corresponding L1 token.
params.l2Token: The address of corresponding L2 token.
params.to: The address of recipient in L2 to receive the token.

finalizeDepositETH(address,address,uint2.details: This function should only be called by L2ScrollMessenger.      This function should also only be called by L1GatewayRouter in L1.

params._amount: The amount of ETH to deposit.
params._data: Optional data to forward to recipient's account.
params._from: The address of account who deposit ETH in L1.
params._to: The address of recipient in L2 to receive ETH.

setDefaultERC20Gateway(address).details: This function should only be called by contract owner.

setERC20Gateway(address[],address[]).details: This function should only be called by contract owner.

params._gateways: The list of addresses of gateways to update.
params._tokens: The list of addresses of tokens to update.

setETHGateway(address).details: This function should only be called by contract owner.

withdrawERC20(address,address,uint256,ui.details: Make this function payable to send relayer fee in Ether.

params.amount: The amount of token to transfer.
params.gasLimit: Unused, but included for potential forward compatibility considerations.
params.to: The address of recipient's account on L1.
params.token: The address of token in L2.

withdrawERC20(address,uint256,uint256).details: Make this function payable to send relayer fee in Ether.

params.amount: The amount of token to transfer.
params.gasLimit: Unused, but included for potential forward compatibility considerations.
params.token: The address of token in L2.

withdrawERC20AndCall(address,address,uin.details: Make this function payable to send relayer fee in Ether.

params.amount: The amount of token to transfer.
params.data: Optional data to forward to recipient's account.
params.gasLimit: Unused, but included for potential forward compatibility considerations.
params.to: The address of recipient's account on L1.
params.token: The address of token in L2.

params.amount: The amount of ETH to be withdrawn.
params.gasLimit: Optional, gas limit used to complete the withdraw on L1.
params.to: The address of recipient's account on L1.

params.amount: The amount of ETH to be withdrawn.
params.gasLimit: Optional, gas limit used to complete the withdraw on L1.

params.amount: The amount of ETH to be withdrawn.
params.data: Optional data to forward to recipient's account.
params.gasLimit: Optional, gas limit used to complete the withdraw on L1.
params.to: The address of recipient's account on L1.

developerDoc.details: This is a base contract to aid in writing upgradeable contracts, or any kind of contract that will be deployed behind a proxy. Since proxied contracts do not make use of a constructor, it's common to move constructor logic to an external initializer function, usually called `initialize`. It then becomes necessary to protect this initializer function so it can only be called once. The {initializer} modifier provided by this contract will have this effect. The initialization functions use a version number. Once a version number is used, it is consumed and cannot be reused. This mechanism prevents re-execution of each "step" but allows the creation of new initialization steps in case an upgrade adds a module that needs to be initialized. For example: [.hljs-theme-light.nopadding] ```solidity contract MyToken is ERC20Upgradeable {     function initialize() initializer public {         __ERC20_init("MyToken", "MTK");     } } contract MyTokenV2 is MyToken, ERC20PermitUpgradeable {     function initializeV2() reinitializer(2) public {         __ERC20Permit_init("MyToken");     } } ``` TIP: To avoid leaving the proxy in an uninitialized state, the initializer function should be called as early as possible by providing the encoded function call as the `_data` argument to {ERC1967Proxy-constructor}. CAUTION: When used with inheritance, manual care must be taken to not invoke a parent initializer twice, or to ensure that all initializers are idempotent. This is not verified automatically as constructors are by Solidity. [CAUTION] ==== Avoid leaving a contract uninitialized. An uninitialized contract can be taken over by an attacker. This applies to both a proxy and its implementation contract, which may impact the proxy. To prevent the implementation contract from being used, you should invoke the {_disableInitializers} function in the constructor to automatically lock it when it is deployed: [.hljs-theme-light.nopadding] ```

Initialized(uint8).details: Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized.

_initialized.details: Indicates that the contract has been initialized.

_initializing.details: Indicates that the contract is in the process of being initialized.

The initialization functions use a version number. Once a version number is used, it is consumed and cannot be reused. This mechanism prevents re-execution of each \"step\" but allows the creation of new initialization steps in case an upgrade adds a module that needs to be initialized. For example: [.hljs-theme-light.nopadding] ```solidity contract MyToken is ERC20Upgradeable {     function initialize() initializer public {         __ERC20_init(\"MyToken\", \"MTK\");     } } contract MyTokenV2 is MyToken, ERC20PermitUpgradeable {     function initializeV2() reinitializer(2) public {         __ERC20Permit_init(\"MyToken\");     } } ``` TIP: To avoid leaving the proxy in an uninitialized state, the initializer function should be called as early as possible by providing the encoded function call as the `_data` argument to {ERC1967Proxy-constructor}. CAUTION: When used with inheritance, manual care must be taken to not invoke a parent initializer twice, or to ensure that all initializers are idempotent. This is not verified automatically as constructors are by Solidity. [CAUTION] ==== Avoid leaving a contract uninitialized. An uninitialized contract can be taken over by an attacker. This applies to both a proxy and its implementation contract, which may impact the proxy. To prevent the implementation contract from being used, you should invoke the {_disableInitializers} function in the constructor to automatically lock it when it is deployed: [.hljs-theme-light.nopadding] ```","events":{"Initialized(uint8)":{"details":"Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized."}},"kind":"dev","methods":{},"stateVariables":{"_initialized":{"custom:oz-retyped-from":"bool","details":"Indicates that the contract has been initialized."},"_initializing":{"details":"Indicates that the contract is in the process of being initialized."}},"version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{},"version":1}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"solidity/L2GatewayRouter.sol":"Initializable"},"evmVersion":"london","libraries":{},"metadata":{"bytecodeHash":"ipfs"},"optimizer":{"enabled":true,"runs":10000},"remappings":[]},"sources":{"solidity/L2GatewayRouter.sol":{"keccak256":"0xbaf2abb35000ef12458d9ffd10fa762e5931eb3962aaed36ef148263c00c4e22","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://87b98336c76187a5731704a41c581e737af524250a6bc5d42411d1cc1c9e7f0e","dweb:/ipfs/QmQjV4ugJ9skQbVafYLwwQRKYrXivitZk2tQBKWPSGcuVB"]}},"version":1}

FinalizeDepositERC20(address,address,add.notice: Emitted when ERC20 token is deposited from L1 to L2 and transfer to recipient.

FinalizeDepositETH(address,address,uint2.notice: Emitted when ETH is deposited from L1 to L2 and transfer to recipient.

SetDefaultERC20Gateway(address,address).notice: Emitted when the address of default ERC20 Gateway is updated.

SetERC20Gateway(address,address,address).notice: Emitted when the `gateway` for `token` is updated.

SetETHGateway(address,address).notice: Emitted when the address of ETH Gateway is updated.

WithdrawERC20(address,address,address,ad.notice: Emitted when someone withdraw ERC20 token from L2 to L1.

WithdrawETH(address,address,uint256,byte.notice: Emitted when someone withdraw ETH from L2 to L1.

ERC20Gateway(address).notice: Mapping from L2 ERC20 token address to corresponding L2ERC20Gateway.

defaultERC20Gateway().notice: The addess of default L2 ERC20 gateway, normally the L2StandardERC20Gateway contract.

finalizeDepositERC20(address,address,add.notice: Complete a deposit from L1 to L2 and send fund to recipient's account in L2.

finalizeDepositETH(address,address,uint2.notice: Complete ETH deposit from L1 to L2 and send fund to recipient's account in L2.

getERC20Gateway(address).notice: Return the corresponding gateway address for given token address.

getL1ERC20Address(address).notice: Return the corresponding l1 token address given l2 token address.

getL2ERC20Address(address).notice: Return the corresponding l2 token address given l1 token address.

setDefaultERC20Gateway(address).notice: Update the address of default ERC20 gateway contract.

setERC20Gateway(address[],address[]).notice: Update the mapping from token address to gateway address.

setETHGateway(address).notice: Update the address of ETH gateway contract.

withdrawERC20(address,address,uint256,ui.notice: Withdraw of some token to a recipient's account on L1.

withdrawERC20(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Withdraw of some token to a caller's account on L1.

withdrawERC20AndCall(address,address,uin.notice: Withdraw of some token to a recipient's account on L1 and call.

withdrawETH(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Withdraw ETH to caller's account in L1.

withdrawETH(uint256,uint256).notice: Withdraw ETH to caller's account in L1.

withdrawETHAndCall(address,uint256,bytes.notice: Withdraw ETH to caller's account in L1.

userDoc.notice: The `L2GatewayRouter` is the main entry for withdrawing Ether and ERC20 tokens. All deposited tokens are routed to corresponding gateways.

developerDoc.details: One can also use this contract to query L1/L2 token address mapping. In the future, ERC-721 and ERC-1155 tokens will be added to the router too.

finalizeDepositERC20(address,address,add.details: Make this function payable to handle WETH deposit/withdraw.      The function should only be called by L2ScrollMessenger.      The function should also only be called by L1ERC20Gateway in L1.

params.amount: The amount of the token to deposit.
params.data: Optional data to forward to recipient's account.
params.from: The address of account who deposits the token in L1.
params.l1Token: The address of corresponding L1 token.
params.l2Token: The address of corresponding L2 token.
params.to: The address of recipient in L2 to receive the token.

finalizeDepositETH(address,address,uint2.details: This function should only be called by L2ScrollMessenger.      This function should also only be called by L1GatewayRouter in L1.

params._amount: The amount of ETH to deposit.
params._data: Optional data to forward to recipient's account.
params._from: The address of account who deposit ETH in L1.
params._to: The address of recipient in L2 to receive ETH.

params._token: The address of token to query.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setDefaultERC20Gateway(address).details: This function should only be called by contract owner.

setERC20Gateway(address[],address[]).details: This function should only be called by contract owner.

params._gateways: The list of addresses of gateways to update.
params._tokens: The list of addresses of tokens to update.

setETHGateway(address).details: This function should only be called by contract owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

withdrawERC20(address,address,uint256,ui.details: Make this function payable to send relayer fee in Ether.

params.amount: The amount of token to transfer.
params.gasLimit: Unused, but included for potential forward compatibility considerations.
params.to: The address of recipient's account on L1.
params.token: The address of token in L2.

withdrawERC20(address,uint256,uint256).details: Make this function payable to send relayer fee in Ether.

params.amount: The amount of token to transfer.
params.gasLimit: Unused, but included for potential forward compatibility considerations.
params.token: The address of token in L2.

withdrawERC20AndCall(address,address,uin.details: Make this function payable to send relayer fee in Ether.

params.amount: The amount of token to transfer.
params.data: Optional data to forward to recipient's account.
params.gasLimit: Unused, but included for potential forward compatibility considerations.
params.to: The address of recipient's account on L1.
params.token: The address of token in L2.

params.amount: The amount of ETH to be withdrawn.
params.gasLimit: Optional, gas limit used to complete the withdraw on L1.
params.to: The address of recipient's account on L1.

params.amount: The amount of ETH to be withdrawn.
params.gasLimit: Optional, gas limit used to complete the withdraw on L1.

params.amount: The amount of ETH to be withdrawn.
params.data: Optional data to forward to recipient's account.
params.gasLimit: Optional, gas limit used to complete the withdraw on L1.
params.to: The address of recipient's account on L1.

developerDoc.title: L2GatewayRouter

developerDoc.details: Contract module which provides a basic access control mechanism, where there is an account (an owner) that can be granted exclusive access to specific functions. By default, the owner account will be the one that deploys the contract. This can later be changed with {transferOwnership}. This module is used through inheritance. It will make available the modifier `onlyOwner`, which can be applied to your functions to restrict their use to the owner.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

__gap.details: This empty reserved space is put in place to allow future versions to add new variables without shifting down storage in the inheritance chain. See https://docs.openzeppelin.com/contracts/4.x/upgradeable#storage_gaps
